news.title: disndat: "Fiver pints, 8 spirits with a dash, €10 Spritzes, free live music and guaranteed great craic"
news.summary: Stuart Clark enjoys a night out in disndat, the student-friendly pub and live music venue in Dame Court, Dublin 2 which has special offers galore and a warm welcome for all.

news.title: Delush announce headline Dublin show
news.summary: Tickets are on sale now and can be found below.

news.title: A Song For Palestine: Musicians to gather for solidarity march in Dublin
news.summary: Kíla fiddle player Dee Armstrong, singer-songwriter Áine Tyrrell and composer Susan Quirke are involved in organising the march.

news.title: Sanatorium Director Gar O'Rourke: “I never set out to make a war film. I wanted to make a film about human experiences"
news.summary: Director Gar O’Rourke discusses his new documentary Sanatorium, which offers a fascinating portrayal of how Ukrainians are coping amid the current conflict with Russia.

news.title: The Altered Hours release new single ‘Turn Away’ and new release date for upcoming album
news.summary: Their self-titled third album will be out on November 7 via Pizza Pizza Records.

news.title: London Film Festival to take place in Belfast next month featuring Hamnet and Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery
news.summary: See the full list of films below.

news.title: CMAT to make US TV debut on The Jimmy Kimmell Show
news.summary: The singer will perform on The Jimmy Kimmell show on Tuesday.

news.title: The Paper Kites announce new album If You Go There, I Hope You Find It and Belfast and Dublin shows
news.summary: They will play the Limelight on February 17 and 3Olympia on February 18.
